intro: Aeschynomene pararubrofarinacea, commonly known as the red-stemmed aeshynomene, is a flowering plant species native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, often red-tinged stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by pods containing several seeds. It is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
